Candy the Egyptian mummy has existed for
thousands of years and still remains intact.  Even after all
those years, the secret of
ancient Egyptian mummification is still something that
experts today have not been able to discover.
However, recently German researchers
have begun to find the first clues.
Using modern molecular analysis technology,
experts from the Mar
Blank Institute in Germany have identified and created the scent of
the extract used to cover the mummy of
Lady Sinne who lived in 1450
BC and was examined by experts.  Ancient
Englishman Howard Carter discovered in
we discovered small samples in
two jars that once contained the lungs and liver of
this lady from these very small seeds.
We have discovered and
restored this type of extract.  wishing that her body could
survive thousands of years. Analyzing the
molecular composition of the specimen,
researchers discovered that inside the
embalmed plaster there was beeswax, vegetable oil, animal sap,
and even black vinegar thanks to a
Perfume experts have recreated more than 20
compounds that create the fragrance. Once a
mummy is discovered, visitors can
enjoy this scent when

This morning, a fire broke out in
a four-story house in Bac Tu Liem district,
Hanoi. Authorities
successfully rescued two children. Bac
Tu Liem Hanoi police said the
fire occurred on  Xuan Dinh Street,
Bac Tu Liem District at about 6:00 a.m. After
receiving the news, the authorities sent
six fire engines and dozens of soldiers
to the scene. The authorities
approached the fire on the fourth floor of the building.
Thanks to timely fire fighting, the fire
was completely extinguished after just 5 minutes.
The working group also rescued two children
safely. The initial cause of the fire
was determined to be due to a short circuit in the hair dryer of
